reasoning: Placed 'main' first to respect the entry-function-first guideline. Next are low-level helpers and direct dependencies used by the core kernel: num_blocks (3) first because kernel (1) calls it; kernel_q (4) and kernel_s (5) are grouped together immediately after num_blocks because they are the worker routines invoked by kernel. Initialization (init_array, 0) follows so setup logic appears before the core orchestration. The core computation function kernel (1) is placed after its dependencies so callers it uses are already visible. Finally print_array (2) is placed last as it is purely a display routine and not needed by other helpers. This ordering improves logical flow (entry → helpers → init → core → output), groups related GPU kernels, and ensures most callees appear before their callers (kernel's callees are before kernel). Note: main remains first by requirement, so its direct callees appear after it despite the general preference for callee-before-caller.
